intro: Stephanomeria thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its globular shape, with tightly packed, woolly leaves and showy yellow flowers. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is a notable species in its native range.
